caption:
This photograph features a gritty urban scene focused on several large golden-tan plastic garbage bags that are tightly sealed and piled together on a grey, stained sidewalk. On the left of the image, there's a large cardboard box, partly crushed and laying on its side. Attached to one of the bags on the right side of the frame, there appears to be a rudimentary drawing or silhouette of a wheelbarrow cut from white material, which could be another plastic bag.

In the background, partially obscured by the garbage, is a commercial window display which seems to be part of a restaurant or food-related business. Visible in the window is an advertisement for "The Blimpie Burger," priced at 99 cents, featuring the image of a hamburger. The tagline below reads "Made for each other." To the left, the window displays slogans promoting beef and a character resembling a cow.

The overall atmosphere of the photograph suggests urban neglect or decay, emphasizing themes like waste, consumption, and perhaps a critique of commerce or fast food culture. The window and the garbage interact visually and thematically, creating a contrast between commerce and waste products.
title: Outside a restaurant in harlem
